lead_paragraph: A joint arming and training program between the C.I.A. and Saudi Arabia reflects the enduring alliance between the nations even as their relationship and the kingdom’s place in the region are in flux.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and MATT APUZZO

headline.print_headline: Saudis, the C.I.A. and the Arming of Syrian Rebels
headline.main: U.S. Relies Heavily on Saudi Money to Support Syrian Rebels

snippet: A joint arming and training program between the C.I.A. and Saudi Arabia reflects the enduring alliance between the nations even as their relationship and the kingdom’s place in the region are in flux.
abstract: Central Intelligence Agency and Saudi Arabia have, since 2013, colluded on arming Syrian rebels, continuing decades-long relationship stretching back through Iran-contra scandal and backing mujahedeen against Soviets in Afghanistan; Saudi Arabia has provided generous financial backing for Syrian mission, as it has on many other joint projects; alliance persists even as ties that bind nations together loosen and shift (Series: Secrets of the Kingdom).
